info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 1:45PM MDT until July 26 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Missoula MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Idaho, including the following county, Lemhi.
This includes the following Specific Areas... Hwy 93 4th of July Creek to Tower Creek and Moose Fire Burn Area.
* WHEN...Until 345 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 143 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Slow moving and training thunderstorms are expected to create heavy rainfall in flood prone areas of western Lemhi County. - This includes the following Specific Areas... Hwy 93 4th of July Creek to Tower Creek and Moose Fire Burn Area. - https://www.weather.gov/mso/hydrology
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
